conclusion: To solve the problem, the effects of the light source moving forward on the shadows cast by the objects will be analyzed, focusing on both position and size changes.
The image shows four objects on a flat surface, each casting distinct shadows labeled A, B, C, and D. The light source is positioned above these objects.
The current shadows A, B, C, and D are cast by the objects due to the initial position of the light source.
If the light source moves forward above the objects, the angle and distance between the light source and the objects will change.
Shadow A will shift forward as the angle and distance between the light source and the object casting it change.
Shadow B will move forward due to the change in angle and distance.
Shadow C's position will change due to the altered angle and distance.
Shadow D will shift forward as the angle and distance change.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will become elongated and larger due to the increased proximity of the light source to the objects and the increased angle of light rays reaching the surface.
Both position and size changes of the shadows are due to the altered angle and distance between the light source and the objects.
When the light source moves forward above the objects, both the position and the size of the shadows will change. The shadows will become elongated and larger.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will move forward as the light source moves forward due to changes in angle and distance.
